clinical_study.brief_title: Patients' Comprehension and Internalization of Operative Consent Form
clinical_study.official_title: Informed Pre-operative Consent: Are We There Yet?

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective pilot study conducted within otolaryngology (ENT) clinics in a tertiary hospital between July and December 2016. 22 patients planned for common elective ENT operations were given a self-administered one-page survey on the same day after preoperative counselling. The investigators aim to identify if there are any associations between perceived and actual understanding of information given during pre-operative counselling and patient satisfaction with the process.

detailed_description.textblock: As above and in later sections.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's perceived understanding of information given during pre-operative counselling (nominal score on questionnaire)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: The score of how certain patients feel about information given during pre-operative counselling, as indicated on a self-administered questionnaire on the same day after pre-operative counselling

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's actual understanding of information given during pre-operative counselling (numeric score on questionnaire)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: The score of correct answers patients give to factual questions about their surgery, as indicated on a self-administered questionnaire on the same day after pre-operative counselling

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's satisfaction with pre-operative counselling (nominal score on questionnaire)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: The score of how satisfied patients are with pre-operative counselling, as indicated on a self-administered questionnaire on the same day after pre-operative counselling

study_pop.textblock: Patients planned for common elective ENT operations in a tertiary hospital between July and December 2016

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Planned for common elective ENT operations
- English-speaking
- Unaccompanied
- Counselled with the use of a structured surgery-specific consent form
